results.title: Learning to jump
results.creator_credit: Justin Milne and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horses: basics to eventing”.
Shows training of horse and rider to jump beginning with poles laid out on the ground and progressing through to a series of jumps.

results.title: Drugs: it's up to you really
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Nottage, Lesley Hammond, Nicholas Cockram, South Australian Film Corporation and Telefeatures
results.brief_description: Groups of students talk about their own experiences with drugs, their attitudes towards drugs and the influences upon them to take various drugs especially cigarettes, alcohol and analgesics. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Love to kill
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kramer and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Searching for values: a film anthology”.
Specially edited from “Bless the beasts and children”. Raises issues surrounding the right to kill, the right to carry and use firearms, and the morality of taking the law into your own hands. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Negro soldier
results.creator_credit: Frank Capra, Stuart Heisler and United States. War Dept.
results.brief_description: World War II propaganda film, outlining the Negro soldier’s participation in war and America history from 1776 to 1944, glossing over issues such as racism and segregation. Acclaimed for its dignity and sincerity when it was released, it now offers a historical perspective of stereotypes and racial attitudes held by the military and the public during the war. Music by Dimitri Tiomkin performed by the Army Air Force Orchestra. Written by Carlton Moss.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Capra, Stuart Heisler and United States. War Dept.

results.title: Shane [Edited version]
results.brief_description: An edited version of the feature film directed by George Stevens. Starring Alan Ladd as the mysterious stranger who assists a family of homesteaders, highlighting the mythology of the Wild West and the image of the American hero.

results.title: My side of the mountain. [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: James B. Clark, Robert B Radnitz and Paramount Communications
results.brief_description: An edited version of the film based on children’s book by Jean George. Relates the experiences of a 13 year old boy as he learns about survival and independence in a mountain wilderness.

results.title: Antarctic crossing
results.creator_credit: George Lowe, James Carr and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: An account of the establishment and execution of the 1957-58 Commonwealth Trans-Antarctic Expedition under Sir Vivian Fuchs, with support by the New Zealand party under Sir Edmund Hillary. Includes excerpts from original films of the Scott and Shackleton Expedition by courtesy of the British Film Institute Archives.

results.title: The Kelly gang
results.brief_description: Restored by the National Film and Sound Archive, this film represents a substantial proportion of the original footage produced by Harry Southwell in 1920. Starring Godfrey Cass as Ned Kelly, the film includes both outdoor scenes and badly dressed roofless studio interiors that reflect Southwell’s inexperience as a producer.

results.title: Antonia: a portrait of the woman
results.creator_credit: Jill Godmilow, Judy Collins and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: Presents a portrait of Antonia Brico, who in the 1930s established an international reputation as an accomplished orchestra conductor. Today she teaches conducting and piano in Denver, while leading the Brico Symphony, a community orchestra which she founded.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jill Godmilow, Judy Collins and Phoenix Films
